programme.title: The 700 Club
programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. On the air since 1966, it launched nationally in '72, before becoming the flagship of the Christian Broadcast Network in 1977. It mixes news---from a religious perspective---with inspirational interviews with celebrities, along with Bible readings and entertainment. Conservative icon (and 1988 presidential candidate) Pat Robertson founded the hugely popular program from a 1963 fund-raising pledge effort on UHF TV in Virginia. (cc)(n).(n)

programme.title: The 700 Club
programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. On the air since 1966, it launched nationally in '72, before becoming the flagship of the Christian Broadcast Network in 1977. It mixes news---from a religious perspective---with inspirational interviews with celebrities, along with Bible readings and entertainment. Conservative icon (and 1988 presidential candidate) Pat Robertson founded the hugely popular program from a 1963 fund-raising pledge effort on UHF TV in Virginia. (cc)(

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Real-life officers are followed by a camera crew, cinéma-vérité style, in a gritty up-close look at police work and the consequences of crime. The result: one of Fox's longest-running series (it premiered in March 1989). It also spawned a number of police-reality imitators. programme.title: English Premier League Soccer
programme.sub-title: West Bromwich Albion FC vs. Watford FC
programme.desc: The two Premier League matches between West Bromwich Albion and Watford last season produced only one goal. After it finished goalless at Vicarage Road in August, the Hornets won 1-0 at The Hawthorns in April with the only goal scored by Ben Watson.(n)

programme.title: English Premier League Soccer
programme.sub-title: Sunderland AFC vs. Leicester City FC
programme.desc: Leicester City did the PL double vs. Sunderland in their title-winning campaign last season, winning 4-2 at home on the opening day of the campaign and then emerging victorious 2-0 from the Stadium of Light in April thanks to a Jamie Vardy double.(n)

programme.title: English Premier League Soccer
programme.sub-title: Stoke City FC vs. Burnley FC
programme.desc: Burnley is unbeaten in their last three PL matches vs. Stoke City, including the 2-1 victory at bet365 Stadium on Nov. 22, 2014 when Danny Ings scored twice. Hull is the only opponent the Clarets have had a longer PL unbeaten run against.(n)

programme.desc: Long-hitting, hard-living golfer John Daly reflects on his rollercoaster career while preparing for the PGA Tour's over-50 circuit. Daly burst onto the scene with two major titles in the early '90s while becoming one of sports' most polarizing figures, as suspensions and multiple trips to rehab tainted his massive on-course appeal as a true everyman. Directed by Gabe Spitzer and David Terry Fine. (repeat) (cc)(

programme.desc: Electrocuted in a hairdryer mishap, womanizing ad exec Nick Marshall (Mel Gibson) is suddenly able to hear the thoughts of the opposite sex. programme.title: Weiner
